title: Prague C & M Classification for Barrett's Esophagus
desc: The Prague C & M Classification for Barrett's esophagus stratifies severity of Barrettâ€™s esophagus according to endoscopic findings.

orgreference.text: Sharma P, Dent J, Armstrong D, Bergman JJ, Gossner L, Hoshihara Y, Jankowski JA, Junghard O, Lundell L, Tytgat GN, Vieth M. The development and validation of an endoscopic grading system for Barrett's esophagus: the Prague C & M criteria. Gastroenterology. 2006 Nov;131(5):1392-9. Epub 2006 Aug 16.

other_refer.text: Eluri S, Shaheen NJ. Barrett's esophagus: diagnosis and management. Gastrointest Endosc. 2017;85(5):889-903.

data.evidence:
Circumferential extent of BE above the GE Junction (C value)

  • Measure the distance from the GE junction to the highest location where metaplasia is present, around the entire circumference of the esophagus.

Maximal extent of BE above the GE Junction (M value)

  • Measure the distance from the GE junction to the highest location of metaplasia.
data.facts:
Interpretation:

The higher the Prague C&M numbers, the more severe the Barrett's esophagus and the higher the risk of developing cancer.
